[vc_custom_heading text=”Cause of Nutritional Disorder” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_class=”m-b-md”]

Hair loss due to nutritional causes is another common factor. As a result, the hair is a living organ, and it needs to be fed and blooded. Irregular and unbalanced diet, long-term hunger, uniform diet and high carbohydrate content to consume foods, ultimately affect and shed hair.

Although there is no nutritional problem, the lack of vitamins and minerals that require for hairs, in the blood is another reason that sheds the hair. If vitamins and minerals such as B12, vitamin D, folic acid, biotin, zinc, iron are low, the hair cannot be fed and shed.

[vc_separator color=”custom” gap=”tall”]
